intro: Ouratea praecox, commonly known as the early flowering ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Ouratea praecox is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and understoreys.
